name: hull
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the body or frame of a ship, most of which goes under the water

to remove the covering or the stem and leaves from some fruits, vegetables, and seeds: We sat in the garden hulling strawberries. Compare
shuck US

a city in northeast England whose full name is Kingston upon Hull : They would travel to Hamburg, then by boat to Hull . We lived in Hull for 17 years.
More examplesFewer examplesThe ports of Hull and Harwich provide important links with the Continent.She studied English Literature at Hull University.He's from Hull and was at the same school as me.

the body or frame of a ship, most of which lies under the water
hull noun [C]
(PLANT COVERING)
the outer covering of a seed or fruit, such as the shell of a nut
